1.str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
Silvanus, a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Of Latin origin; 'silvan'; Silvanus, a Christian.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
A Thessalonian. From Thessalonike; a Thessalonican, i.e. Inhabitant of Thessalonice.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

2.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
2.str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

2.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Remembrance, recollection, mention; commemoration. From mnaomai or mimnesko; recollection; by implication, recital.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.

3.str2: Unceasingly, without remission. Adverb from adialeiptos; uninterruptedly, i.e. Without omission.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: From a derivative of mneme; to exercise memory, i.e. Recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).

And, even, also, namely.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From kopto; a cut, i.e. toil, literally or figuratively; by implication, pains.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

4.str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

4.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Plural
4.str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

9.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

(act of) entering, an entrance, entry. From eis and hodos; an entrance.

To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
